message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM 

This paper deals with the task of detecting relations among objects in images, which is a fundamental problem in computer vision. The paper proposes a novel approach based on one-shot learning, which is a popular research area in computer vision and machine learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also involves natural language processing, as it aims to bridge the semantic gap between images and natural language. Hence, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is another likely sub-category. The paper proposes a Semantics Induced Learner (SIL) model that combines bottom-up and top-down attention mechanisms, which are popular techniques in deep learning. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are also likely sub-categories. Finally, the paper evaluates its proposed approach on two large-scale datasets, which involves image and video data. Therefore, cs.MM (Multimedia) is another possible sub-category.
